search_results.full_title: Emotions and Math by Margaret Glaspy
search_results.title: Emotions and Math
search_results.lyrics:
Emotions and Math Lyrics[Verse 1]
Oh when I got you by my side
Everything's alright
Its just when you're gone
I start to snooze the alarm
Cause I stay up until 4 in the morning

[Pre-Chorus]
Counting all the days 'til you're back
Shivering in an ice cold bath
Of emotions and math
[Verse 2]
Oh it's a shame
And I'm to blame
'Cause we're alright
Until you go
And I start losing control
Without a warning

[Pre-Chorus]
Counting all the days 'til you're back
Shivering in an ice cold bath
Of emotions and math

[Chorus]
I've gotta get out of this tree
Off of this limb
I'm a woman acting like a kid
A skinny mess
That's breathless from telling you
All the things that I'm gonna do

[Verse 3]
I was a rolling stone
Out on my own
But now that you're here
I'm just living in fear
Of you leaving
You might also like[Pre-Chorus]
Counting all the days 'til you're back
Shivering in an ice cold bath
Of emotions and math

[Chorus]
I've gotta get out of this tree
Off of this limb
I'm a woman acting like a kid
A skinny mess
That's breathless from telling you
All the things that I'm gonna do1Embed

songs.full_title: Emotions And Math - Recorded at Spotify Studios NYC by Margaret Glaspy
songs.title: Emotions And Math - Recorded at Spotify Studios NYC
songs.title_with_featured: Emotions And Math - Recorded at Spotify Studios NYC

annotations:
I was a rolling stone
 Out on my own
 But now that you’re here
 I’m just living in fear
 Of you leaving

She was doing just fine before she met this person, doing her own thing, out on her own.

Now her mind is so distracted from the anxiety of this person leaving, she can’t seem to focus on much more than emotions and math.

She’s aware of how she’s acting, and doesn’t like it.
She misses her old independent ways, and wants to get back to them, but she doesn’t know how to be alright without this person.

Using juxtaposition to clearly state how much things have changed for her, it just goes to show how meeting someone can totally change your life, for the good, or bad. (or both sometimes)

Its just when you’re gone
 I start to snooze the alarm
 Cause I stay up until 4 in the morning
Margaret stays up so late when her lover’s gone because she thinks about them so much instead of sleeping and has trouble falling asleep because of this.
Counting all the days ’til you’re back

She alludes to how people try to comfort themselves when they desperately await something, in this case, her lover to return. You know those times when you think to yourself “I’m going to sleep in a few hours so it doesn’t count as a day, and the day he comes back doesn’t count as a day, so its really not that long.”

Shivering in an ice cold bath
 Of emotions and math

Emotions: longing for her lover to come back.
Math: counting the days until he is back.

She tries to be practical about waiting for him to come back, but the emotions flood her.

Emotions and math (also the name of the album) are a symbol of how everything in life is a mix of emotions and logic and how everything we look at, like relationships, is affected by both of them.

You said "Nobody make a fuss
The dogs I like are dangerous"
I feel like I saw you dead

You're smiling but I don't believe...You might also likeEmbed

annotations: There was not enough of me to keep you always company
She felt as though she needed to always be keeping this person company, but she simply couldn’t extend her time or energy in the ways that would help this person or make them feel satisfied.

Spending all my nights in the world’s prettiest lace
 I feel like I saw you dead
She is trying her hardest to please this person, but they still seem emotionally dead or void.

Devotion Lyrics[Verse 1]
I know it’s hard to think I might be needing something
You didn’t know I needed
'Cause you put your guard up
Faster than Formula One racing at full speed

[Chorus]
Baby, I’m on your side
When I give you a piece of my mind
It’s a sign of my devotion
When I show you my emotions
Baby, I’m on your team
We don’t need to fight and scream
It’s a sign of my devotion
When I show you my emotions
[Verse 2]
I try my best to get all the nonsense off my chest
And wear my heart on my sleeve
But more and more I wonder what I’m trying for
When you find my heart hard to believe

[Chorus]
But baby, I’m on your side
When I give you a piece of my mind
It’s a sign of my devotion
When I show you my emotions

[Bridge]
Don’t have a heart attack when I talk back
I love you just the same
Don’t let the world stop spinning
When I won’t take the blame
Don’t have a heart attack when I talk back
I love you just the same
Oh and don’t let the world stop spinning
When I won’t take the blame

[Chorus]
'Cause baby, I’m on your side
When I give you a piece of my mind
It’s a sign of my devotion
When I show you my emotions
Baby, I’m on your team
We don’t need to fight and scream
It’s a sign of my devotion
When I show you my emotionsYou might also likeEmbed

search_results.full_title: Somebody to Anybody by Margaret Glaspy
search_results.title: Somebody to Anybody
search_results.lyrics:
Somebody to Anybody Lyrics[Verse 1]
I'm a little rock on a big mountain
Nobody's calling my name
Nobody's paying me mind
I'm a little drop from a big fountain
Oh, I blend in and that's fine, fine

[Verse 2]
And my sister, she is gonna die trying
With her heart ablaze
And a fighting song
Not me, I'll be a dandelion
Ooh, give a gust of wind
And I'm gone, gone
[Chorus]
'Cause I don't wanna be somebody to anybody, no
I'm good at no one

[Verse 3]
Once I was loved, and I wouldn't dare
Take a compliment or give a kiss
Just thinking of being a pair
Had me suffering and made me split

[Chorus]
Oh, because I don't wanna be somebody to anybody, no
I'm good at no one

[Bridge]
I keep my head down and both eyes wide
I don't look up, just side to side
And I stay well kept so they can see
There's nothing wrong with me

[Chorus]
It's just that I don't wanna be somebody to anybody, no no no
No, I don't wanna be somebody to anybody, no
No, I don't wanna be somebody to anybody, no
I'm good at no oneYou might also likeEmbed

description.plain:
“Somebody to Anybody” is a song written by Margaret Glaspy and is on her debut album, Emotions and Math. The album was released on ATO records in 2016 and is still Glaspy’s only available full-length project. Margaret first recorded vocal and guitar demos of the the songs on the album in her apartment, and then recorded them with a band at her friends house. Soon after she was contacted by ATO records and was able to re-record the album in a professional studio in New York with drummer Tim Kuhl and bass player Chris Morrissey. “Somebody to Anybody” is the only song on the album that is just Margaret singing without any accompaniment besides her guitar.
The stripped back instrumentation of the song allows the listener to focus on Margaret’s emotional vocal performance and metaphorical lyrics. However, the song doesn’t feel like it’s missing anything as the drop D tuning and tone of her telecaster guitar make the sonic landscape feel full even with only one instrument. The verses consist of specific metaphors for how Glaspy is happy to remain unseen and lay low while the chorus is more explicit in delivering the same message. A quirky descending single note guitar line that follows the end of each chorus feels intimate and fits the vibe of the song as a whole.
    Margaret has cited the works of Elliott Smith, Weezer, Joni Mitchell, and Jimi Hendrix as some of her biggest influences. It is easy to hear Elliott Smith’s simply spoken yet profound lyrical style in Margaret’s songs, as well as the mix of Jimi Hendrix’s music in the drum sounds on her album as well as her grungy guitar tones. Margaret has only been around for a few years, but her songs are likely to influence songwriters for years to come. For example, budding folk artist Madison Cunningham has clearly taken a lot from Margaret in terms of the tone of her voice and style of her guitar playing.

body.plain:
“Somebody to Anybody” is a song written by Margaret Glaspy and is on her debut album, Emotions and Math. The album was released on ATO records in 2016 and is still Glaspy’s only available full-length project. Margaret first recorded vocal and guitar demos of the the songs on the album in her apartment, and then recorded them with a band at her friends house. Soon after she was contacted by ATO records and was able to re-record the album in a professional studio in New York with drummer Tim Kuhl and bass player Chris Morrissey. “Somebody to Anybody” is the only song on the album that is just Margaret singing without any accompaniment besides her guitar.
The stripped back instrumentation of the song allows the listener to focus on Margaret’s emotional vocal performance and metaphorical lyrics. However, the song doesn’t feel like it’s missing anything as the drop D tuning and tone of her telecaster guitar make the sonic landscape feel full even with only one instrument. The verses consist of specific metaphors for how Glaspy is happy to remain unseen and lay low while the chorus is more explicit in delivering the same message. A quirky descending single note guitar line that follows the end of each chorus feels intimate and fits the vibe of the song as a whole.
    Margaret has cited the works of Elliott Smith, Weezer, Joni Mitchell, and Jimi Hendrix as some of her biggest influences. It is easy to hear Elliott Smith’s simply spoken yet profound lyrical style in Margaret’s songs, as well as the mix of Jimi Hendrix’s music in the drum sounds on her album as well as her grungy guitar tones. Margaret has only been around for a few years, but her songs are likely to influence songwriters for years to come. For example, budding folk artist Madison Cunningham has clearly taken a lot from Margaret in terms of the tone of her voice and style of her guitar playing.

annotations:
Because I don’t wanna be somebody to anybody, no
 I’m good at no one
Margaret would rather be alone than with somebody because when you’re alone you have nobody to let down.

Not me, I’ll be a dandelion
 Ooh, give a gust of wind
 And I’m gone, gone
Margaret won’t fight like her Sister because she would rather not have the attention that it would attract.

I’m a little drop from a big fountain
 Oh, I blend in and that’s fine, fine
Margaret is perfectly fine with laying low and being unseen.
And I wouldn’t dare
Correction: “and I wouldn’t dare.”

search_results.full_title: You and I by Margaret Glaspy
search_results.title: You and I
search_results.lyrics:
You and I Lyrics[Verse 1]
Oh, tonight I'm a little too turned on to talk about us
And tomorrow I'll be too turned off and won't give a fuck
About you and I

[Chorus]
I don't wanna see you cry
But it feels like a matter of time

[Verse 2]
I'm not looking for an open door to talk about love
Maybe you agree, but I see you saving pictures of
You and I
[Chorus]
I don't wanna see you cry
But it feels like a matter of time

[Verse 3]
Here I thought we had some kind of understanding
That we're no Dick and Jane out on parade
Not looking for lengthy or demanding
Nothing's lost if nothing's gained

[Verse 4]
A smile is just a smile
A kiss is just a kiss
Though I see you all the while reading into it
No, it's no you and I

[Chorus]
I don't wanna see you cry
But it feels like a matter of time

[Verse 5]
I think you might be harboring a heartache
I think you might be crying when I'm gone
You and I have been a mistake
I let it linger too longYou might also likeEmbed

description.plain: This song is about a relationship that is seen differently by the two people in it. The singer saw this as a hook up or a friends with benefits type of relationship while the other one sees it as a romantic relationship as well and wants more from her.

search_results.title: Heartbreak
search_results.lyrics:
Heartbreak Lyrics[Verse 1]
Don't think I don't see you trying to say goodbye
Did you ever even say hello?
You've got wings, take flight
Break your vow to never let me go
It seems you're writing a book
On how to make the heart ache
And I've tried not to look
For my own heart's sake
I thought I was happy
They swear you're a saint
And here I am suffering in vain
[Chorus]
I'm feeling like my body's a burden
Or just a place to put all of my pain
If not love, what are you serving?
Heartbreak, heartbreak
Heartbreak, heartbreak
Heartbreak, heartbreak
Heartbreak

[Verse 2]
It seems you're writing a book
On how to make the heart ache
And I've tried not to look
For my own heart's sake
I thought I was happy
I did a double take
And saw myself suffering in vain

[Chorus]
I'm feeling like my body's a burden
Or just a place to put all of my pain
If not love, what are you serving?
Heartbreak, heartbreak
Heartbreak, heartbreak
Heartbreak, heartbreak
Heartbreak
You might also like[Outro]
And I wonder how did I sleep under your spell
Bending over backward, still I break
And we promised we'd always be honest and tell
Each other everything give or take
And I wonder how did I sleep under your spell
Bending over backward, still I break
And we promised we'd always be honest and tell
Each other everything give or takeEmbed
